data.text: Many have sinned for a small matter;
As a nail sticketh fast between the joinings of the stones;
Unless a man hold himself diligently in the fear of the Lord,
As when one sifteth with a sieve, the refuse remaineth;
The furnace proveth the potterâ€™s vessels;
The fruit declareth if the tree have been dressed;
Praise no man before thou hearest him speak;
If thou followest righteousness, thou shalt obtain her,
The birds will resort unto their like;
As the lion lieth in wait for the prey;
The discourse of a godly man is always with wisdom;
If thou be among the undiscreet, observe the time;
The discourse of fools is irksome,
The talk of him that sweareth much maketh the hair stand upright;
The strife of the proud is bloodshedding,
Whoso discovereth secrets loseth his credit;
Love thy friend, and be faithful unto him:
For as a man hath destroyed his enemy;
As one that letteth a bird go out of his hand,
Follow after him no more, for he is too far off;
As for a wound, it may be bound up;
He that winketh with the eyes worketh evil:
When thou art present, he will speak sweetly,
I have hated many things, but nothing like him;
Whoso casteth a stone on high casteth it on his own head;
Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein:
He that worketh mischief, it shall fall upon him,
Mockery and reproach are from the proud;
They that rejoice at the fall of the righteous shall be taken in the snare;
Malice and wrath, even these are abominations;
